keyMoments.title: Usopp's Immunity to Negative Hollows Revealed
keyMoments.description: Usopp discovers he is completely immune to Perona's Negative Hollow powers because he is naturally so pessimistic and negative about himself that the ghosts cannot make him feel any worse.
keyMoments.significance: One of Usopp's most iconic moments, proving that his perceived weaknesses can be his greatest strengths in the right situation.

keyMoments.title: Multiple Negative Hollows Backfire
keyMoments.description: When Perona sends four Negative Hollows through Usopp, his extreme negativity causes the ghosts themselves to become depressed instead of affecting him.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Usopp as Perona's natural enemy, similar to how Luffy was Enel's natural enemy.

keyMoments.title: Salt Star Technique Debut
keyMoments.description: Usopp debuts his new Salt Star technique, firing salt-filled pellets that instantly purify Perona's zombie servants.
keyMoments.significance: First use of a technique specifically designed to counter the Thriller Bark zombies' weakness to salt.

keyMoments.title: Usopp Volunteers to Fight Perona Alone
keyMoments.description: Despite his fear, Usopp tells his stronger crewmates to go ahead while he stays behind to fight Perona and her forces alone.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's growth in courage and his willingness to protect his friends despite his natural cowardice.
keyMoments.quote: You guys go ahead! I'll handle this!

abilities.description: Usopp fires pellets filled with salt from his slingshot. The salt is particularly effective against Thriller Bark's zombies, as it instantly purifies them by forcing their stolen shadows to return to the original owners.

Usopp's naturally pessimistic and negative personality makes him completely immune to Perona's Negative Hollow attacks, as he already thinks so poorly of himself that the ghosts cannot make him feel any worse.

relationships.description: Usopp is Perona's natural enemy due to his immunity to her Negative Hollow powers.

evolutionMoments.description: Usopp discovers he is immune to Perona's Devil Fruit powers and volunteers to fight her alone.

reveals.information: Usopp is naturally immune to Perona's Negative Hollow attacks due to his extremely pessimistic personality
Usopp has developed the Salt Star technique to counter Thriller Bark's zombies

keyMoments.title: Negative Hollows Overwhelm the Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Perona demonstrates the devastating psychological power of her Horo Horo no Mi by sending Negative Hollows through Zoro, Sanji, and Franky, completely incapacitating them with crushing depression.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that Perona's Devil Fruit can defeat even the strongest Straw Hats through mental rather than physical attacks.
keyMoments.quote: You made it into my room... my patience is wearing thin.

keyMoments.title: Discovery of Natural Enemy
keyMoments.description: Perona discovers that Usopp is completely immune to her Negative Hollow powers, shocking her as she realizes her supposedly invincible ability has a fundamental weakness.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals that Perona's powerful Devil Fruit can be countered by someone with a naturally negative personality.

abilities.description: Perona creates ghost-like Hollows that pass through targets, filling them with crushing negative thoughts and depression that leaves them unable to fight.
Perona can connect her awareness to multiple Negative Hollows to gather information about what's happening throughout Thriller Bark.

relationships.description: Usopp is Perona's natural enemy, as his negative personality makes him immune to her Devil Fruit powers.

evolutionMoments.description: Perona discovers that her Negative Hollows are completely ineffective against Usopp.

reveals.information: Perona's Negative Hollow powers cannot affect people who are already extremely negative about themselves

keyMoments.title: Zoro Defeated by Negative Hollow
keyMoments.description: Even Zoro's immense willpower cannot resist Perona's Negative Hollow, causing him to fall to his knees expressing a desire to be reborn as a clam.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that mental/psychological attacks can defeat even the strongest-willed warriors if they attack the mind rather than the body.
keyMoments.quote: If I were to be reborn, I'd like to be a clam.

keyMoments.title: Sanji Defeated by Negative Hollow
keyMoments.description: Perona's Negative Hollow passes through Sanji, causing him to apologize for being born as crushing depression overwhelms him.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that even Sanji's strong sense of self cannot withstand Perona's psychological attack.

keyMoments.title: Franky Creates Corduroy Bridge
keyMoments.description: When Oars destroys the stairs, Franky quickly constructs a corduroy bridge to allow the crew to cross and continue their mission.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Franky's engineering skills and quick thinking in crisis situations.

keyMoments.title: Franky Defeated by Negative Hollow
keyMoments.description: Perona's Negative Hollow affects even the super-confident Franky, causing him to call himself a perverted hunk of scrap metal.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that Perona's power works even on cyborgs and those with artificial bodies.
keyMoments.quote: I'm just a perverted hunk of scrap metal.

keyMoments.title: Oars Creates a Pirate Hat
keyMoments.description: Oars fashions a makeshift pirate bicorne hat from mansion debris, mimicking Luffy's personality and dream of becoming Pirate King.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that Oars has fully absorbed Luffy's personality along with his shadow, making him a greater threat as he shares Luffy's determination and ambitions.
keyMoments.quote: I'm gonna be King of the Pirates!

reveals.information: Oars has fully adopted Luffy's personality, dreams, and mannerisms due to having Luffy's shadow
